TELEGRAPHIC ADDRESS EASTERTIDE. r?') /trsifawri: 14 th August, ^ 44^ The Political Agent, Bahrain* Dear Sir, Our staff complain that they have been unable to obtain any kind of meat in the bazaar for the past fortnight* Vegetables also are unobtainable. We shall be grateful therefore if you can assist us in any way in obtaining essential supplies for our staff through any other channel* In making this request, we presume that you consider the bank one of the essential services in Bahrain* Yours faithfully. Manager*

physicalDescription.extent: A page of file notes (f 3) follows the file’s single piece of correspondence.

Foliation: the foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 4; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: A single piece of correspondence, a letter from D Ham, Manager of the Bahrain branch of Eastern Bank Limited, to the Political Agent at Bahrain, dated 14 August 1944 (folio 2). Ham writes that his staff complain of having been unable to obtain meat in the bazaar for a fortnight, and asks if essential supplies can be obtained through other channels. A note left by a member of Agency staff in the file notes, dated 20 August 1944 (folio 3), states that Ham has said the ‘position has now improved.’
